704296f-a.text:
(1)
Flatbush Ave., east side, between Clarendon Road and Ave. D., showing the Cap't Cornelius Vanderveer house, also known as the Flag house. (Cap't Vanderveer was born in 1731 in the old house built by his father on this site, and it was upon this site in 1787, that the present house was built by the Captain.  It was demolished in 1911. It stood south of Vanderveer Place.in 1880, and in Vanderveer Place in 1908, and No. 1159, where it is supposed to have stood is just north of
the same street.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing barns on the right at the rear of the house.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704296f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Clarendon Road, Brooklyn, NY

704295f-b.text:
1162-66 Flatbush Avenus, adjoining the S.N. oorner of Dorchester Road, showing the Suydam-Ditmars House, built about 1700 and torn down in 1911. Hendrick Suydam, born in 1731, purchased the farm in 1759 from the heirs of Jacobus Lott. The house was owned by the Ditmars family until 1909. John Ditmars, s) n-in-law or Capt.
Andrew Suydam, was the first Ditmars owner.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  Ahout 1898
May Be Reproduced  Views 1,2
704295f-b.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Dorchester Road, Brooklyn, NY
